features.name: Eiffel Tower
features.description: A global cultural icon of France and one of the most recognizable structures in the world.

features.name: Statue of Liberty
features.description: A colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor within New York City.

features.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
features.description: The oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex.

features.name: Puerta del Sol
features.description: One of the best known and busiest places in Madrid, known as the center of the radial network of Spanish roads.

features.name: Brandenburg Gate
features.description: An 18th-century neoclassical monument in Berlin, built on the orders of Prussian king Frederick William II.

features.name: Tokyo Tower
features.description: A communications and observation tower in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan.

features.name: Big Ben
features.description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London.

features.name: Hollywood Sign
features.description: An American landmark and cultural icon overlooking Hollywood, Los Angeles.

features.name: Sydney Opera House
features.description: A multi-venue performing arts centre at Sydney Harbour, known for its unique use of a series of gleaming white sail-shaped shells as its roof structure.
